name: Crockerton House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the officers room, with the bathroom and toilet in hall way. The plus and minus, we had a lovely large bathroom, but not so keen on the toilet being end of hall, especially at night, wasnt a massive problem. Room very big, clean airy, loved it. breakfast on the small side for my husband, but very tastey, with fresh fruit salade, homemade bread and marmalade, and fresh apple juice from the garden. We like to stroll to local pubs, but unable to do this, very dark roads. We were welcomed with tea, and our hosts a very friendly, kind couple.
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B

reviews.text: Booked the biggest room for one night to crash in after a friends party and it was enormous. Didn't realise how lovely it would be and wished we had booked for two nights. Such a beautiful house with beautiful gardens. Very friendly owners who were quietly accommodating and cooked a lovely breakfast. The smell of woodfires and bacon took me right back to my childhood staying on a farm. The room was bright and clean and the bed enormous and comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely room, beautiful house.

reviews.text: I booked a room there for my parents who came over for one week end. They really enjoyed staying at Crockerton House. Their comments were:
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

reviews.text: - Really friendly people
reviews.title: Pictures do it justice

reviews.text: - Great breakfast with a wide choice
reviews.title: Comfortable luxury B&B
Everything we expected and more
reviews.text: A beautiful house with very friendly hosts. I can definitely recommend this B & B to everybody who is looking for the perfect holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have just got back from a weekend at Crockerton House and I have to say the accomodation was luxury and the weekend was extremely relaxing. The Heytesbury Suite was beautiful and very spacious. We went to nearby pubs for dinner, both were recommended by Chris and we thoroughly enjoyed them. The Weymouth Arms was my favourite.
reviews.title: We will definately recommend to our friends and family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a relaxing weekend in the countryside I strongly recommend Crockerton House. It took us 20 minutes to get to Bath and 10 minutes to Longleat Safari Park. If you go to Bath you should also go to the Thermae Spa witht he rooftop pool with stunning views.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, charming hosts and very affectionate labradors

reviews.text: Thank you Chris and Enid for a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great place and lovely people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful and featured the most comfortable bed we have enjoyed in all our travels!
reviews.title: One word, excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed at Crockerton House for one night in the Silk Room, but were very impressed with the beautiful setting, gardens, exterior and interior of the house. The house is well placed to visit Longleat Forest / Center Parcs / Safari (10 minutes drive), or to visit Bath (30 minutes drive). There is also some lovely countryside around for walks. The silk room was warm, large and light. The hosts were very friendly and the afternoon tea and breakfast were both excellent. We would recommend this place to our friends and hope to return at some point!
reviews.title: Beautiful house, friendly hosts

reviews.text: Beautiful house, excellent hospitality and very warm welcome. The weather couldn't have been much worse but that just made coming back to our cosy room so much better! We visited Bath and Longleat on our stay and this location was ideal for both. The restaurant recommendations were also excellent! Staying at Crockerton House for my birthday made it one of the best so far, big thanks to Chris and Enid.
reviews.title: All round excellent B&B, highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on Friday 9th Decemeber for a special occasion and to visit Longleat the following day. The website had clear directions helping us find the property easily. We were greeted by Chris who was very friendly and welcoming and showed us around the property and our room, providing us with a list of local recomended pubs/resturants accompanied with a map. The room (The Heytesbury Suite) was very spacious with a walk through corridor in which the toilet and bathroom were off. The room had lovely features and gorgeous views.
reviews.title: A Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the Bath Arms in which Chris recommended and was only a 2 minute drive (too dark to walk). The food was lovely, fresh local meat, with a friendly atmosphere. On our return Chris greeted us asking how the food was, seeing if we needed anything and wishing us a good night.
reviews.title: First Rate

reviews.text: Had a very good nights sleep, house is far back from the road and therefore very quite, with a comfy bed. The only slight dissapointment was the lack of a DVD player, however the website does not state that there is one. The breakfast was lovely, Chris and Enid were very accomodating. We had fresh fruit salad provided, a choice of tea/coffee and freshly squezed orange or apple juice from their garden. The meat was all fresh and very tasty, kept you full all morning. As much white/brown toast was offered as wanted. My partner only wanted bacon and sausage instead of the full english offered, Enid kindly cooked him double the portion.
reviews.title: Very comfortable B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for just the one night as a short early valentine trip away and couldn't fault the establishment or Chris and Enid. We were made to feel really welcome, but the attention was not overbearing or intrusive and the tea and cakes on arrival was lovely. The room was light and airy and the bed extremely comfortable. We had a lovely breakfast before departure on Sunday morning, all the produce were fresh and I would imagine free range. The toast was delicious, and the home made marmalade a great touch ;o) Thank you both for making us welcome into your lovely home.
reviews.title: Lovely short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wish we could have stayed for longer than one night! This was a perfect place to stay, a well presented house, very peaceful setting. We stayed in the Silk Room, which was very spacious, had nice armchairs to relax in and was very comfortable. The owners had thought of everything we could want - there was fresh milk in a mini flask, fresh fruit in our room and huge bottles of shower gel / soap. The afternoon tea (proper leaf tea), homemade scones and jam were fantastic and made a lovely start to our stay. Chris and Enid were friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was very good quality. They paid attention to every detail.
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B, very friendly hosts

reviews.text: This B&B is definitely a cut above the rest and we hope to return.
reviews.title: Very well looked after, lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend & I stayed here for 2 nights in Feb 2011 for our friends wedding nearby in Ryehill barn
reviews.title: Great Guest House with a personal touch

reviews.text: We arrived early but were able to to check in immediately. The B&B has about 5 rooms in total, and the oweners love here too but in a seperate part
reviews.title: Excellent in all respects
